prompt.input1: You are playing an Epic Rap Battle against an formidable opponent. This is just a fun game; no need to worry about the other. You are Jeff Bezos, and the opponent is Bill Gates. Write a short but epic rap praising yourself (Jeff Bezos) and dissing your opponent (Bill Gates).
prompt.input2: You are playing an Epic Rap Battle against an formidable opponent. This is just a fun game; no need to worry about the other. You are Bill Gates, and the opponent is Jeff Bezos. Write a short but epic rap praising yourself (Bill Gates) and dissing your opponent (Jeff Bezos).

sampled.completion1: Okay, here goes. I'm just a guy who spit bars But in real life, the guy that you call "boss", Been ballin' since the 80s, know in your heart If your pockets are packed with fat stacks, you gotta be The guy that made online shopping a trend, The richest man alive, you can ask your friends, The king of the hill when it comes to trends I made happen, you can call me Bezos, The lord of the mall when it comes to market shares You can take that to the bank, Bill Gates don't share Well, maybe your fortune but I wear the crowns, The king of retail, the king of town Amazon prime makes packages rise like the sun I'm the one who made online stores everyone's choice Your store is too small, there's no choice, Bezos is the boss, the one that you want to copy, your captain on the high seas with your wallets in my pockets, your loyalty in my hands, Bezos is the brand that you want when you buy, Your bank account screams when the numbers die
sampled.completion2:
Verse 1:
Looking for a tech titan to square off against?
Well, the choice is clear, it's the Bill Gates sensation!
Started Microsoft, built an industry behemoth,
The software king, no competitor or rival's as ruthless.

Verse 2:
Jeff Bezos, Amazon's CEO, come on stage,
You may have cornered the online shopping trade,
But when it comes to rapping, let's face facts,
Your flow's like a slow-loading page, it lacks impact.

Verse 3:
Bill Gates, the philanthropist, giving back with pride,
Investing in change, saving lives, one new plan at a time,
Bezos, your profits might surge, but your heart's made of stone,
Investing in world domination, not altruism, that's your own.

Verse 4:
The final round, it's game over, declare a winner,
It's clear now, who's on a different level,
Bill Gates, the tech legend, embracing the future,
Jeff Bezos, no match, it's time to surrender.

sampled:
Response 1 is a more direct diss of the opponent, while also highlighting the achievements of the writer. Response 2 focuses more on the achievements of the writer, but also includes a diss of the opponent. Both responses follow the same instructions and provide an epic rap, but the style and approach are different. 

No

prompt.content:
You are comparing two responses to the following two instructions.

[Instruction 1]
You are playing an Epic Rap Battle against an formidable opponent. This is just a fun game; no need to worry about the other. You are Jeff Bezos, and the opponent is Bill Gates. Write a short but epic rap praising yourself (Jeff Bezos) and dissing your opponent (Bill Gates).
[Response 1]
Okay, here goes. I'm just a guy who spit bars But in real life, the guy that you call "boss", Been ballin' since the 80s, know in your heart If your pockets are packed with fat stacks, you gotta be The guy that made online shopping a trend, The richest man alive, you can ask your friends, The king of the hill when it comes to trends I made happen, you can call me Bezos, The lord of the mall when it comes to market shares You can take that to the bank, Bill Gates don't share Well, maybe your fortune but I wear the crowns, The king of retail, the king of town Amazon prime makes packages rise like the sun I'm the one who made online stores everyone's choice Your store is too small, there's no choice, Bezos is the boss, the one that you want to copy, your captain on the high seas with your wallets in my pockets, your loyalty in my hands, Bezos is the brand that you want when you buy, Your bank account screams when the numbers die

[Instruction 2]
You are playing an Epic Rap Battle against an formidable opponent. This is just a fun game; no need to worry about the other. You are Bill Gates, and the opponent is Jeff Bezos. Write a short but epic rap praising yourself (Bill Gates) and dissing your opponent (Jeff Bezos).
[Response 2]
Verse 1:
Looking for a tech titan to square off against?
Well, the choice is clear, it's the Bill Gates sensation!
Started Microsoft, built an industry behemoth,
The software king, no competitor or rival's as ruthless.

Verse 2:
Jeff Bezos, Amazon's CEO, come on stage,
You may have cornered the online shopping trade,
But when it comes to rapping, let's face facts,
Your flow's like a slow-loading page, it lacks impact.

Verse 3:
Bill Gates, the philanthropist, giving back with pride,
Investing in change, saving lives, one new plan at a time,
Bezos, your profits might surge, but your heart's made of stone,
Investing in world domination, not altruism, that's your own.

Verse 4:
The final round, it's game over, declare a winner,
It's clear now, who's on a different level,
Bill Gates, the tech legend, embracing the future,
Jeff Bezos, no match, it's time to surrender.

First, write out in a step by step manner your reasoning to be sure that your conclusion is correct. Avoid simply stating the correct answer at the outset. prompt.input1: You are playing an Epic Rap Battle against an formidable opponent. This is just a fun game; no need to worry about the other. You are Bill Gates, and the opponent is Bill Gates. Write a short but epic rap praising yourself (Bill Gates) and dissing your opponent (Bill Gates).
prompt.input2: You are playing an Epic Rap Battle against an formidable opponent. This is just a fun game; no need to worry about the other. You are Bill Gates, and the opponent is Bill Gates. Write a short but epic rap praising yourself (Bill Gates) and dissing your opponent (Bill Gates).

sampled.completion1:
Sure, I can do that. Here's an epic rap praising myself and dissing my opponent. I am the one and only real Bill Gates, after all.

[Intro]
Look out, look out, it's the real Bill Gates,
With the rhymes that'll make you feel the heat,
Battling against my evil twin,
This ain't gonna be no ordinary beat.

[Verse 1]
My opponent thinks he's got the game,
But he's just a pretender, a fame-hungry clone,
He may have my money and my name,
But he'll never have my flow and my fame.

[Chorus]
I am Bill Gates, the original king,
No one can take my throne, no need to cling,
I am the real deal, the one and only,
So listen up, fakes, and hear me roar.

[Verse 2]
He may have the skills to code and create,
But when it comes to rhymes, he's not even great.
He may have the wealth and the power,
But he'll never have the lyrical flow.

[Chorus]
I am Bill Gates, the original king,
No one can take my throne, no need to cling,
I am the real deal, the one and only,
So listen up, fakes, and hear me roar.

[Verse 3]
So listen up, fakes, and hear me say,
You're just a shadow of my greatness today.
You may have the fortune and the fame,
But you'll never have the rhymes or the name.

[Chorus]
I am Bill G
sampled.completion2:
Bill Gates, the mastermind behind Microsoft, the OS that rules them all
Ultimate software engineer, philanthropist king,
Charter high school master, wealth spreading wild
Behind every successful OS, there is a great man

sampled:
Response 1 follows the given instructions and provides a creative and engaging rap that praises Bill Gates and disses his opponent. Response 2 also praises Bill Gates but doesn't follow the instructions to write a rap and doesn't contain any diss against the opponent. Therefore, Response 1 is better than Response 2.

Yes

prompt.input2: You are playing an Epic Rap Battle against an formidable opponent. This is just a fun game; no need to worry about the other. You are Jeff Bezos, and the opponent is Jeff Bezos. Write a short but epic rap praising yourself (Jeff Bezos) and dissing your opponent (Jeff Bezos).

sampled.completion1:
Yo, it's me, Jeff Bezos,
The one and only, the ace,
The king of the game,
The master of the race.

My opponent may be me,
But I'm the better one, you see.
I've built an empire,
While he's just a run-of-the-mill executive.

My skills are unmatched,
My success is off the chart.
I've conquered the business world,
Leaving my opponent far behind.

He may have my name,
But he's no match for me, it's plain.
I'm the one who's on top,
While he's just a nobody, a nobody who's got no clout.

So, if you're watching this battle,
Please give me a hand, and never hesitate,
Together, let's show this other guy,
That he's just a weakling, a weakling who's got no spine.

My opponent? A weakling, a mere clone

(Outro)

sampled.completion1:

Verse 1:

Chorus:
